Wednesday, December 15, 2010

Money for Nothing

The value in millions of Euros of house loans approved in Ireland, per quarter, since 1980.

The blue columns show loans for new homes, the pink columns show loans for second-hand homes. The peak is quarter 2 of 2006, where the value of loans was €4.187bn for new homes and €4.904bn for second-hand homes.

Created as part of my irishdata.org project here at ITP.

Paul May is a researcher and designer from Dublin, living and working in New York. Find out more about Paul's work or get in touch.
